options.option-description: Use the class .alert-success for a success alert box. This alert box indicates a successful or positive action, such as successfully submitting a form.
options.alert-message:
Thank you!

Thank you for submitting your details. If you have any questions please email example@st-andrews.ac.uk.

options.option-description: Use the class alert-info for an info alert box. This alert box indicates neutral information or a neutral action, such as a recommendation or an update.
options.alert-message:
Did you know?

University of St Andrews was founded over 600 years ago? Find out more about the history of St Andrews.

options.option-description: Use the class alert-warning for a warning alert box. This alert box indicates a warning that might need attention or carries a time limit, such as impending application deadlines.
options.alert-message:
Warning!

The deadline for submissions is the end of Semester 2. If you need help, please email example@st-andrews.ac.uk.

options.option-description: Use the class alert-danger for a danger alert box. This alert box indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action such as closures or expired deadlines.
options.alert-message:
Submissions have ended

The deadline for submissions has passed. If you need help please email example@st-andrews.ac.uk.
